Ethan Frome

by Wharton, Edith

Published: 2004

Pages: 117

Rating:★★★☆☆

Review

A mournful story of rural life in the 1800s. I found it beautiful for its slow careening pace, but I wouldn't recommend it to everyone.

Frankenstein

by Shelley, Mary

Published: 2008

Pages: 261

Rating:★★★★★

Review

One of my favorite books I've ever read. There is a reason this is hailed as one of the greatest works of modern literature, and there is way more than any pop culture rendition of the story.

Imbeciles:

The Supreme Court, American Eugenics, and Sterilization of Carrie Buck

by Cohen, Adam

Published: 2017

Pages: 401

Rating:★★★★☆

Review

Horrifying, enlightening, and enraging. Really well written, and spoiler the injustices by the state chronicled in the book are still legal today.
